Trial_Design.evidence: patients randomized to continuous biventricular pacing (n = 16) or standard of care (n = 18)

Intervention.evidence: patients randomized to continuous biventricular pacing (n = 16) or standard of care (n = 18)

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized that changes in intrinsic heart rate can explain variable effects of atrial pacing in this setting.

Method_Outcome.evidence: analyzed in patients randomized to continuous biventricular pacing

Number_Randomised.evidence: patients randomized to continuous biventricular pacing (n = 16) or standard of care (n = 18)

Result_Outcome.evidence: intrinsic heart rate was lower in the paced group 12 to 24 hours after bypass (76.5 ± 17.5 vs 91.7 ± 13.0 beats per minute; P = .040)
